H0.text: Mars has a warmer average surface temperature than Earth.

H1.text: Moon has a warmer average surface temperature than Earth.

H2.text: Pluto has a warmer average surface temperature than Earth.

H3.text: Venus has a warmer average surface temperature than Earth.

A4.text: The surface temperatures of Venus are at least 735 K (462 째C; 864 째F). This makes the Venusian surface hotter than Mercury's, even though Venus is nearly twice Mercury's distance from the Sun and thus receives only around a quarter of Mercury's solar irradiance, of 2,600 W/m2 (double that of Earth).

A5.text: The average surface temperature is 737 K (464 째C; 867 째F), above the critical points of both major constituents and making the surface atmosphere a supercritical fluid of mainly supercritical carbon dioxide and some supercritical nitrogen.
